verses.verse: "Surely <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> is a mine <S%H4161><s%> for silver, <S%H3701><s%> And a place <S%H4725><s%> where they refine <S%H2212><s%> gold. <S%H2091><s%>
"Iron <S%H1270><s%> is taken <S%H3947><s%> from the dust, <S%H6083><s%> And from rock <S%H68><s%> copper <S%H5154><s%> is smelted. <S%H6694><s%>

"[Man] puts <S%H7760><s%> an end <S%H7093><s%> to darkness, <S%H2822><s%> And to the farthest <S%H3605><s%> limit <S%H8503><s%> he searches <S%H2713><s%> out The rock <S%H68><s%> in gloom <S%H652><s%> and deep <S%H6757><s%> shadow. <S%H6757><s%>

"He sinks <S%H6555><s%> a shaft <S%H5158><s%> far from habitation, <S%H1481><s%> Forgotten <S%H7911><s%> by the foot; <S%H7272><s%> They hang <S%H1809><s%> and swing <S%H5128><s%> to and fro <S%H5128><s%> far from men. <S%H582><s%>
"The earth, <S%H776><s%> from it comes <S%H3318><s%> food, <S%H3899><s%> And underneath <S%H8478><s%> it is turned <S%H2015><s%> up as fire. <S%H784><s%>
"Its rocks <S%H68><s%> are the source <S%H4725><s%> of sapphires, <S%H5601><s%> And its dust <S%H6083><s%> [contains] gold. <S%H2091><s%>

"The path <S%H5410><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> bird <S%H5861><s%> of prey <S%H5861><s%> knows, <S%H3045><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> has the falcon's eye <S%H5869><s%> caught <S%H7805><s%> sight <S%H7805><s%> of it.
"The proud <S%H7830><s%> beasts <S%H1121><s%> have not trodden <S%H1869><s%> it, Nor <S%H3808><s%> has the [fierce] lion <S%H7826><s%> passed <S%H9380><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> it.
"He puts <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> on the flint; <S%H2496><s%> He overturns <S%H2015><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> at the base. <S%H8328><s%>
"He hews <S%H1234><s%> out channels <S%H2975><s%> through the rocks; <S%H6697><s%> And his eye <S%H5869><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%> anything <S%H3605><s%> precious. <S%H3366><s%>
"He dams <S%H2280><s%> up the streams <S%H5104><s%> from flowing; <S%H1065><s%> And what <S%H8587><s%> is hidden <S%H8587><s%> he brings <S%H3318><s%> out to the light. <S%H216><s%>
"But where <S%H370><s%> can wisdom <S%H2451><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%>? And where <S%H335><s%> is the place <S%H4725><s%> of understanding <S%H998><s%>?
"Man <S%H582><s%> does not know <S%H3045><s%> its value, <S%H6187><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> is it found <S%H4672><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the living. <S%H2416><s%>
"The deep <S%H8415><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> 'It is not in me'; And the sea <S%H3220><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> 'It is not with me.'

"Pure <S%H5462><s%> gold <S%H5458><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> be given <S%H5414><s%> in exchange <S%H8478><s%> for it, Nor <S%H3808><s%> can silver <S%H3701><s%> be weighed <S%H8254><s%> as its price. <S%H4242><s%>
"It cannot <S%H3808><s%> be valued <S%H5541><s%> in the gold <S%H3800><s%> of Ophir, <S%H211><s%> In precious <S%H3368><s%> onyx, <S%H7718><s%> or sapphire. <S%H5601><s%>

"Gold <S%H2091><s%> or glass <S%H2137><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> equal <S%H6186><s%> it, Nor <S%H3808><s%> can it be exchanged <S%H8545><s%> for articles <S%H3627><s%> of fine <S%H6337><s%> gold. <S%H6337><s%>
"Coral <S%H7215><s%> and crystal <S%H1378><s%> are not to be mentioned; <S%H2142><s%> And the acquisition <S%H4901><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is above <S%H4480><s%> [that of] pearls. <S%H6443><s%>
"The topaz <S%H6357><s%> of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> equal <S%H6186><s%> it, Nor <S%H3808><s%> can it be valued <S%H5541><s%> in pure <S%H2889><s%> gold. <S%H3800><s%>
"Where <S%H370><s%> then does wisdom <S%H2451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> from? And where <S%H335><s%> is the place <S%H4725><s%> of understanding <S%H998><s%>?
"Thus it is hidden <S%H5956><s%> from the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> living, <S%H2416><s%> And concealed <S%H5641><s%> from the birds <S%H5775><s%> of the sky. <S%H8064><s%>
"Abaddon <S%H11><s%> and Death <S%H4194><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> 'With our ears <S%H241><s%> we have heard <S%H8085><s%> a report <S%H8088><s%> of it.'
"God <S%H430><s%> understands <S%H995><s%> its way; <S%H1870><s%> And He knows <S%H3045><s%> its place. <S%H4725><s%>
"For He looks <S%H5027><s%> to the ends <S%H7098><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> And sees <S%H7200><s%> everything <S%H3605><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the heavens. <S%H8064><s%>
"When He imparted <S%H6213><s%> weight <S%H4948><s%> to the wind, <S%H7307><s%> And meted <S%H8505><s%> out the waters <S%H4325><s%> by measure, <S%H4060><s%>
When He set <S%H6213><s%> a limit <S%H2706><s%> for the rain, <S%H4306><s%> And a course <S%H1870><s%> for the thunderbolt, <S%H6963><s%> <S%H2385><s%>
Then <S%H227><s%> He saw <S%H7200><s%> it and declared <S%H5608><s%> it; He established <S%H3559><s%> it and also <S%H1571><s%> searched <S%H2713><s%> it out.

"And to man <S%H120><s%> He said, <S%H559><s%> 'Behold, <S%H2005><s%> the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord, <S%H136><s%> that is wisdom; <S%H2451><s%> And to depart <S%H5493><s%> from evil <S%H9563><s%> is understanding. <S%H998><s%>'"
